YourCustomerService.purpose: Manage all aspects of customer relationships, from initial prospecting to ongoing account maintenance and support. This service supports sales, marketing, finance, and customer service teams in understanding customer needs, assessing creditworthiness, facilitating transactions, and delivering excellent service experiences.

Customer.description: Core business entity containing key customer data used across sales cycles, marketing campaigns, financial processes, and service interactions. Supports targeted engagement, risk assessment, order fulfillment, and tailored experiences.

fields.CustomerID: Unique identifier assigned to each customer record, used for tracking all associated activities, transactions, and communications.
fields.CompanyName: Official registered business name, used for legal/contractual purposes as well as customer-facing branding and personalization.
fields.CreditLimit: Maximum outstanding balance a customer can carry based on financial health and payment history. Informs order approval, payment terms, and collection strategies.
fields.ContactEmail: Preferred email address for customer communications such as promotions, order confirmations, billing notifications, and service updates.

CustomerAddress.description: Captures physical locations associated with a customer for purposes such as shipping, billing, tax calculations, and service dispatches. Supports seamless order fulfillment and accurate geographic segmentation.

fields.AddressID: Unique identifier for a specific customer address to enable tracking of multiple locations.
fields.AddressType: Categorizes address purposes such as 'Billing', 'Shipping', 'Office', enabling proper routing for different workflows.
fields.Street: Street name and number comprising the primary address line for mapping and navigation purposes.
fields.City: City name for the address, used in logistics planning and market segmentation analysis.
fields.PostalCode: Postal code/ZIP code for precise location identification and compliance with regional tax/duty calculations.

use_cases: Find a customer by name, ID or other criteria
Get customer contact information for marketing campaigns
Check customer credit status before approving an order
Analyze customer geographic distribution and demographics
Update billing or shipping addresses for existing customers
Retrieve complete customer profile for account reviews
Flag high-risk customers based on credit scores
Get list of customers eligible for credit limit increase
Identify customers in same area for local promotions

YourSalesOrderService.purpose: Manage the full sales order lifecycle from initial quote to final delivery. Support sales representatives, customer service, logistics, and finance teams with real-time visibility into customer orders, inventory availability, pricing, shipping, and invoicing. Enable data-driven decisions to optimize sales processes, inventory levels, and customer experience.

SalesOrder.description: Central repository for customer orders capturing all commercial terms. Used by sales reps to create quotes and orders, customer service for order tracking and issue resolution, logistics for delivery planning and execution, and finance for invoicing and revenue recognition. Integrated with inventory, pricing, shipping and accounting modules.

fields.OrderID: Unique, sequential order number automatically assigned for easy reference and tracking across departments. Used for order communications with customers.
fields.CustomerID: Unique identifier linking the order to the customer's master data like name, address, payment terms etc. Enables account management, credit checks and customer-specific pricing/discounts.
fields.OrderDate: Date when the sales order was created, important for determining pricing, promotions, delivery lead times and revenue recognition cut-off dates.
fields.OrderStatus: Current stage in the order lifecycle e.g. Draft, Submitted, Confirmed, Shipped, Invoiced etc. Enables prioritization, escalation handling and management of customer expectations.
fields.TotalAmount: The total monetary value of the order including all line items, taxes, shipping and other charges. Used for cash flow projections, credit limit checks and accounting entries. Currency inherited from customer master data.
fields.DeliveryDate: Requested or committed delivery date driving logistics planning and a key factor in customer satisfaction. Based on product availability, shipping method, and agreed lead times.

SalesOrderItem.description: Individual line items capturing the products and services the customer is purchasing. Critical for inventory management, cost calculations, and enabling product-specific business processes like serialization, kitting, and installation services. Linked to product master data for technical details.

fields.ItemID: Unique identifier for each line item on the sales order, enabling clear reference and tracking of individual products/services.
fields.ProductID: Identifier linking the item to the product master data containing details like description, specifications, tax codes, supersession, and approved vendors.
fields.Quantity: Number of units the customer is ordering, used for inventory reservations, delivery planning, and calculating extended totals. Unit of measure inherited from product master.
fields.UnitPrice: The per-unit price for this product, net of customer-specific pricing conditions like discounts and promotions. Currency inherited from header.
fields.LineTotal: The monetary extension of quantity multiplied by unit price, excluding taxes and other charges which are summarized at header level.

use_cases: Check availability and pricing for a product
Create a sales quote for a customer
Convert a quote to a confirmed sales order
Track the status of an existing order
Expedite or change an order based on customer request
View all open orders for a customer
Analyze top selling products and customers
Forecast expected revenue and delivery volumes
Identify bottlenecks and issues in the order process
Ensure compliance with pricing agreements and policies

YourInventoryService.purpose: Provide comprehensive inventory visibility and control across the entire supply chain to optimize stock levels, fulfill customer orders efficiently, and drive cost-effective procurement and replenishment decisions.

Product.description: Manage all product master data including item details, categorization, pricing, and inventory policies to support sales, procurement, manufacturing, and logistics processes.

fields.ProductID: Uniquely identify each product item for tracking and traceability across the supply chain.
fields.ProductName: Descriptive product name for clear identification, search, and display in catalogs and orders.
fields.Category: Classify products into logical groupings for analysis, planning, and targeted marketing/sales strategies.
fields.StockQuantity: Current inventory levels for each product at warehouses/locations to monitor availability and plan replenishment.
fields.ReorderLevel: Minimum desired stock level that triggers procurement process for timely replenishment to avoid shortages.
fields.UnitPrice: Selling price per unit for revenue calculations, profit margins, and pricing strategies/promotions.

StockMovement.description: Track all inventory transactions like receipts, issues, and transfers to maintain accurate stock levels, analyze consumption patterns, and reconcile with financial records.

fields.MovementID: Unique identifier for each inventory transaction for auditing and control purposes.
fields.ProductID: Product item code involved in the stock movement for tracking specific item quantities.
fields.MovementType: Categorize transactions as receipts (from vendors), issues (to customers/production), or transfers between locations.
fields.Quantity: Number of units received, shipped, or transferred in the transaction for stock level updates.
fields.MovementDate: Timestamp of when the inventory transaction occurred for chronological tracking and reporting.
fields.Warehouse: Originating or destination warehouse/location involved in the stock movement for inventory balancing.

use_cases: Check available quantities for products to promise accurate delivery dates to customers
View stock levels by warehouse/location to identify overstocked or understocked items
Analyze historical issues and receipts to forecast future demand and plan replenishment
Identify fast/slow moving products to optimize inventory and avoid obsolescence
Reconcile inventory transactions with accounting records for financial audit purposes
Monitor reorder levels and create purchase requisitions for timely vendor replenishment
Track product movements across supply chain for logistics planning and cost optimization
Perform inventory cycle counts and investigate discrepancies between system and physical counts
